## GAD-7 vs SPPC

Psychologists often require the task of comparing different psychological questionnaires to better understand the overlap and disparity of concepts. One such comparison is between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Self-Perception Profile for Children (SPPC). This process, known as harmonisation, can be quite labor-intensive and often subjective. However, the Harmony software has been designed to facilitate this process and alleviate the burden of harmonisation for psychology researchers. Harmony uses advanced Natural Language Processing and generative AI models to compare and harmonise questionnaire items, even when these instruments are written in different languages. So, whether you are looking to compare the seven items of GAD-7 vs SPPCâ€™s two items, Harmony is the tool for you. Simply select the GAD-7 and SPPC from Harmony's extensive database, or drag and drop your own PDF versions into the user-friendly web interface. Harmony's AI then generates a percentage match between each item, providing an objective measure of similarity and difference. By using Harmony for your GAD-7 vs SPPC comparison, you eliminate the risk of subjective bias and save significant time in the harmonisation process. Plus, you can also extend your comparisons across numerous longitudinal studies and across multiple languages. Therefore, when it comes to GAD-7 vs SPPC - or any other comparative harmonisation - Harmony is the tool that can revolutionize your psychology research.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SPPC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SPPC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SPPC into Harmony</a> - compare SPPC with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
